answers.author: Amanda Dodge
answers.text:
Hi Marnie,  
There have actually been quite a few questions on this topic posted on the Knowledge Network. Responses to these questions include documents posted on the Knowledge Network, as well as specific plans from local governments.   
This question and answer provides a document from Virginia Beach for employee suggestions:  
http://bit.ly/g3Zs1Y 
Additionally, Deputy HR Director James May posed a question about the types and amounts of awards granted to employees for implemented suggestions. He also attached guidelines for Phoenix’s program. Those who answered the question provided anecdotal evidence and models from federal programs:  
http://bit.ly/dQctRZ 
Finally, the city of Mesa, Arizona wanted to know about employee engagement tactics and got many helpful responses. There is a list of programs to encourage employees as well as employee engagement plans from three different areas:  
http://bit.ly/fpYomB 
I was also able to locate an award application for the city of Collinsville, Illinois which details their strategic plan. Their plan has a heavy focus on improving employee engagement and environment.  
http://bit.ly/hDFwtW 
I hope this helps!  
Amanda Dodge  
International City/County Management Association  
202-962-3699  
adodge@icma.org

answers.author: Vickie Atkinson
answers.text:
Our City Manager, Tom Bonfield, launched a major organizational renewal and employee engagement initiative that we call the Culture of Service soon after he came. There are 3 components: Service to Self, Service to Co-workers and Service to Community with tenets under each. We launched Culture of Service strategy teams in each department a year ago and we're celebrating successes tomorrow at our 1 year anniversary gathering. We're seeing very positive results.
We've recently completed our biennial employee opinion survey and Strategy Teams will be assisting department directors in developing action plans to celebrate areas where things are going well and improving areas that need change. Our Culture of Service initiative has a major focus on involving our employees in positive change.

author: Marnie Green
text:
Public employees face a great deal of uncertainty today.  Many agencies are facing continuing budget cuts which may include cuts to employee benefits.  While there are many conversations we need to have as a result of the current situation, one question stands out for me:
What can public sector managers and supervisors do on a day-to-day basis to keep employees engaged and focused on providing high quality service to citizens?
Please share your ideas, examples, and tools for helping employees stay focused and productive in difficult times.  What is your agency doing to enhance employee engagement?
title: Engaging Public Employees in Uncertain Times
